title: Lamb Shanks
introduction: Lamb shanks are a delightful, hearty dish perfect for cooler evenings. Slow-cooked to perfection, this meal offers tender meat that falls off the bone, bathed in a rich, savory sauce.
instructions: Season the lamb shanks with salt and pepper.
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the lamb shanks on all sides, then remove them from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion, carrots, and garlic to the pot. Saut√© until the vegetables are tender.
Pour in the red wine and bring it to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
Add the beef stock, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, rosemary, thyme, and bay leaves. Stir to combine.
Return the lamb shanks to the pot, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 2 to 2 and a half hours, or until the lamb is tender.
About 30 minutes before the cooking time is up, stir in the pearl barley.
Remove the bay leaves and discard them. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
variations: For a Moroccan twist, add a teaspoon of ground cumin, ground coriander, and a pinch of saffron.
Add some chopped potatoes and bell peppers for extra heartiness.
